metadata.title: CVE-2024-11700 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: Malicious websites may have been able to user intent confirmation throughtapjacking. This could have led to users unknowingly approving the launchof external applications, potentially exposing them to underlyingvulnerabilities. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 133 and Thunderbird <133.

criterions.comment: mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs115: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
